cross.tools
Class ArrayTools

java.lang.Object
  cross.tools.ArrayTools

public class ArrayTools
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class providing methods for Sparse and Dense Arrays.

Author:
Nils.Hoffmann@cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de

createDenseArray

public static void createDenseArray(Array source_ind,
                                    Array source_val,
                                    Tuple2D<Array,Array> tiv,
                                    double min,
                                    double max,
                                    int nbins,
                                    double resolution,
                                    double fillvalue)
Create binned arrays from source mass_values and intensity_values arrays. Takes a Tuple of two initially null or intialized arrays which are the binned representations. Requires minimum and maximum mass values, number of bins, resolution and the fillvalue for empty bins.

Parameters:

source_val -
tiv -

glue

public static Array glue(java.util.List<Array> al)
Concatenates one-dimensional arrays in list into one contiguous array, in iteration order. Note that this method currently only accepts numeric arrays as input and returns an Array of type ArrayDouble.D1. Access to the list is synchronized within the method, so access will be exclusive to this method while executing it.

Parameters:
al -
Returns:
